title: Increasing Subsequences
text:
Given a sequence of N (1 ≤ N ≤ 10,000) integers S1, ..., SN(0 ≤ Si< 100,000), compute the number of increasing subsequences of S with length K (1 ≤ K ≤ 50 and K ≤ N); that is, the number of K-tuples i1, ..., iKsuch that 1 ≤ i1< ... < iK≤ N and Si1< ... < SiK.InputThe first line contains the two integers N and K. The following N lines contain the integers of the sequence in order.OutputPrint a single integer representing the number of increasing subsequences of S of length K, modulo 5,000,000.ExampleInput:4 3
1
2
2
10Output:2The two 3-tuples are (1, 2, 4) and (1, 3, 4), both corresponding to the subsequence 1, 2, 10.
